intro: Machaeranthera canescens var. ambigua, commonly known as the gray bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its grayish, hairy stems and blue to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, narrow leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer. This variety is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
